column1: Salumbar is a small town and a municipality in Udaipur district in the Indian state of Rajasthan. It was ruled by the Chundawat Sisodia rajputs of Mewar.
Salumbar is located at 24.13°N 74.05°E﻿ / 24.13; 74.05. It has an average elevation of 262 metres (859 feet).

column1: Salumbar was a princely state of British India. The Salumber royal house was founded by Rawat Chunda Singh
column2: the eldest son of Maharana Lakha of Mewar. The present titular head of the royal family is Devrath Singh.
